newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - April 1.

text.p: Following were the leading stories in Sri Lankan newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Sri Lankan President Chandrika Kumaratunga officially invited by the Maldivian government to attend the ninth SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation) summit to be held in the Maldive Islands from May 12-14.
Government slashes textile prices by five percent ahead of the upcoming New Year shopping season. Sri Lanka celebrates the Sinhalese and Tamil New Year in mid-April.
Security at the northern Karainagar navy base stepped up after a navy trooper shot dead a suspected separatist Tamil Tiger rebel inside the base.
Two people killed and eleven more injured when they were struck by lightening while working in paddy field in a village near northern Vavuniya, 254 km (158.7 miles) from Colombo.
Armed force recover large haul of arms and bombs from house in northern Jaffna peninsula, which is controlled by army.

Indian fishermen claim to have spotted bodies, believed to be those of a Sri Lankan air force helicopter crew, off the coast of southern India. The Mi-24 helicopter gunship went missing off Sri Lanka's east coast last month with eight crew aboard.
Government cuts price of textiles by five percent ahead of the upcoming New Year shopping season.
